radiographic_examinations.findings: 2 bullets in the right ventricle and signs of pericardial effusion with an initial cardiac tamponade.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After 29 years the patient is alive and well.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A 4-mm bullet in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient remains asymptomatic after 32 years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A 6.35-mm bullet in the anterolateral wall of the left ventricle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After 39 years the patient is alive and well.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A needle in the left ventricle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Forty years later the patient is alive and well.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A needle in the left atrium.
A fragmented needle in the main pulmonary artery.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient died 19 years later of cancer.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A 10-cm catheter fragment in the right ventricle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: After 21 years the patient is alive and well.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A knotted and entrapped catheter in the right atrium.
A 4-cm retained fragment of a central venous catheter in the right pulmonary artery.
A grenade fragment near the left atrium.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient died 17 years later of an unknown cause.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A circular saw fragment in the right ventricle.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient is alive and well after 11 years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A valvulotomy ring in the left atrium.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient was lost to follow-up after 7 years, at which time she was in good clinical condition.
